Posts.Content: All the best for a quick recovery Rob. Sorry to hear you've had another visit from Mr Foley
Posts.Signature: JAN 2016-Age 60 PSA 11.7 was 2.8 in 2013 FEB-Ultrasound shows 75g prostate MAR-MRI results not good MAY-18 core biopsy. Biopsy result 2 of 18 cores positive D3 1 mm Gleason 4 + 4 G3 3mm Gieason 3 + 3 NG 1a & D2 high-grade PIN lesions CONCLUSION Gleason 3 + 4 Without peri-nerve involvement, without invasion of peri-prostatic space. Stage: PT2C JUL Bone scan & abdominal CT clear OCT 13 Laparoscopic surgery by Dr Alharbi(Excellent) at CHU hospital Caen France.Went well & home on 15th Catheter out 21st Oct.Dry at nights but stress incontinence during day PATHOLOGY Tumor initially diagnosed Gleason 3 + 4 concerned right lobe, left lobe, the posterolateral part of gland & the apex. It is Gleason 6: 3 + 3 without extra prostatic extension without peri-nerve infiltration without a vascular embolus with healthy boundaries. Had 24 physio visits for incontinence.Now 7 months post surgery small occasional leaks.Partial erections PSA: 14 Nov 16 0.04 03 May 17 <0.014

Posts.Content: Just wanted to thank all of you for the great advice and help on this forum. I've been lurking on the forum since I had my surgery 7 months ago. Once again many thanks.

Posts.Title: Hi all First post

Posts.Content: Yes, Pathology report downgraded tumor to Gleason 3+3 as you said great news.
Posts.Title: Hi all First post

Posts.Content: I had an infection which started 10 days after my biopsy.Had to visit the ER,they did blood tests and said it was a Prostate infection and put me on a course of antibiotics. I recommend that you regularly monitor your temperature and if it rises immediately visit your doctor.

Posts.Title: Infection timing after biopsy?
